com.avaya.csta.physical

Class RingerPatternConstants

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.avaya.csta.physical.RingerPatternConstants

  • public class RingerPatternConstants
extends java.lang.Object
    A type-safe enumeration for Ring Patterns. These constants represent the various ring types delivered by Avaya Communication Manager, such as normal ringing, priority ringing, attendant emergency ringing, etc.

    Ring patterns are used in these methods:

    • PhysicalDeviceListener.ringerStatusUpdated() is given the RingerStatusEvent parameter containing the ringer's status. Compare RingerStatusEvent.getRingPattern() to RingerPatternConstants.
    • PhysicalDeviceServices.getRingerStatus() returns the status of the ringer on the specified device, including the ring pattern. Compare RingerStatusItem.getRingPattern() to RingerPatternConstants.

     public void ringerStatusUpdated( RingerStatusEvent event) {
     //If it is not a normal incoming ring, just return and ignore it.

     if(!RingerPatternConstants.RINGING.equals(event.getRingPattern())) {
         return;
     }

     System.out.println("The phone is ringing.");
     answerCall();
 }
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.2 $
    Author:
    AVAYA, Inc.
